name: adrenal gland thickening
description: Adrenal gland thickening is evidenced by increased uniform or focal gland thickness on CT or MRI, with the normal limb width typically less than 10 mm; imaging features such as attenuation values, enhancement patterns, and presence of mass effect may assist in differentiating between benign and malignant etiologies.

attributes.name: presence
attributes.description: This indicates whether adrenal gland thickening is detected.

values.name: absent
values.description: No adrenal gland thickening is present.

values.name: indeterminate
values.description: Cannot determine whether adrenal gland thickening is present.

values.name: unknown
values.description: The status regarding adrenal gland thickening is uncertain.

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: This refers to the anatomical region where adrenal gland thickening is located.
